Key Arguments: The Bill threatens freedom of speech and democratic rights.
The definitions of 'misinformation' and 'disinformation' are vague and open to subjective interpretation.
The Bill could lead to censorship by forcing digital platforms to self-censor to avoid penalties.
Exemptions for government and certain organizations are unjustifiable and problematic.
The penalties are excessively harsh and reminiscent of authoritarian regimes.
Notable Quotes: This Bill inflicts a new level of control over our lives.
The presumption involved in exempting government, state-licensed news media, academics and entertainers from this oppressive regime is breath-taking.
Imprisonment for 12 months! Similarly the fines are designed to be repressive.
Freedoms must be protected from government over-reach.
